title: Just because others have it worse than you doesn‚Äôt mean your pain and suffering doesn‚Äôt matter/is not valid

author: memelord_mike
text: The mentality that "someone else had it worse, so accept whatever you got" is something sadists and enablers use to keep us ACoNs in the dark and stunted in our healing. I remember getting this flak from members of my community growing up as well as douchebags on internet forums had this effect on me.

author: freenas_helpless
text: "Get down the cancer wards and get some fucking perspective" is something I heard a lot. Then next breath "Why haven't you cleaned up the dishes??? No other child would EVER do this to their mother"

author: memelord_mike
text: They could compare us to other children all they wanted. But we mention parenting techniques considered human in the 21st century? RRRRRRRRRRRREEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE!!!!!!!!

author: Salt-Light-Love
text: ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not everyone else‚Äôs mother.‚Äù

author: heyomeatballs
text: An acquaintance of mine once said "If you didn't have cancer then your childhood wasn't that bad" and I was like "BOY HOWDY DO I HAVE SOMETHING TO TELL YOU"

author: shit_dog
text: Been there a bunch of times, but how the hell do you explain that something to someone? I had trouble explaining it to a lifelong friend and he KNEW what my mom was capable of. Hard to avoid the feeling that my PTSD is invalid because I can't nail it down to one instance or sum it up in an easily understandable sentence.

author: heyomeatballs
text:
I feel like that myself too, and with my C-PTSD too. I'm... I don't wanna say lucky, but my n-mom literally kidnapped me and nearly killed my infant baby sister with neglect so I usually lead with that and add "and she got worse with age".

Sometimes just saying "my parents were abusive" is enough, because it's true, even if they never hit you.

author: Salt-Light-Love
text: I basically do this, but with a ‚Äúsoft‚Äù story.

author: whattfisthisshit
text: My mom hospitalized me for 2 years when I was 4 by pouring boiling water on my legs during one of her fits, and growing up I still heard ‚Äúgo to the cancer ward and see how the children there are living‚Äù

author: heyomeatballs
text: Good god that is beyond awful. I can't imagine how painful that would be, I'm so so sorry you had to experience that. What a terrible memory to have.

author: whattfisthisshit
text: I am emotionally fine 20 years later, but I still get hurt thinking sometimes how screwing up my legs for life and making sure I don‚Äôt feel confident about my looks was not enough that she had to always put it down with ‚Äúgo to cancer ward‚Äù or ‚Äúgo to orphanage‚Äù and see how they are living. Not gonna lie I dreamt of moving to an orphanage as a kid even though now I realize it‚Äôs a very selfish thought. I just don‚Äôt understand how she can take that and even then try to make me feel guilty with ‚Äúit could be worse‚Äù. No mom, in my world it was as bad as it could get. I know it‚Äôs shitty for me to say but as a child all I thought was ‚Äúcancer could mean death and I could be free‚Äù and ‚Äúorphanage doesn‚Äôt have you‚Äù.  And honestly the thing that frustrates me the most is still being told ‚Äúshe‚Äôs your mom, the only mom you have, you can‚Äôt hate her!‚Äù Yes. Yes I can. I‚Äôm sorry for this rant, just got emotional and angry for a second lol

author: heyomeatballs
text:
This is definitely the right place for an emotional rant! I sympathize with those thoughts completely- I used to plan out how to run away when I was younger, but when I got old enough to realize that wouldn't work in a town of 2,000 people that four generations of your family lives in I switched to looking up how to get emancipated, rent rates for apartments, could I survive on my waitress job and still finish high school (I could not), I even seriously talked to my uncle on my mother's side about moving in with him.

I hate my parents. Honestly and truly. It's nice to be able to say that without people screaming that I shouldn't. Usually my reply to "you can't hate them!" is "why not? they hate me. they told me that many times. why am i obligated to love someone who doesn't love me?"

author: whattfisthisshit
text:
Wow are we almost twins? I‚Äôm from a town of 3000 people. And since I was removed from my family at 14, I tried for a long time to graduate high school but could not because couldn‚Äôt study and work full time at the same time. (Waitress first, then McDonald‚Äôs nightshifts to try to make it to classes, ended up with a nice burnout)

I completely understand the feeling of hate. I really never felt any negative feeling so strong towards anything in my life compared to what I feel for my mom and stepdad. It really feels freeing to admit it without anyone telling me I‚Äôm bad or ungrateful

author: [deleted]
text: "She's your mom and the only one you've got. You HAVE to forgive her. You don't want to have any regrets." It took me a long time to realise how WRONG this idea is. It doesn't matter who the person is. NO ONE has a free pass to abuse you.

author: rockyatcal
text:
You got that exactly! I have been NC for over 20 years and I still get that every now and then. No- I do NOT have to forgive anyone but myself. I am worth the time and energy it takes to keep myself from being poisoned and burnt and hit and belittled - the ONLY forgivness I need to participate in is forgiving myself for not eliminating the relationship earlier and loving myself through it all. And I forgive me for that. And when I realized THAT was my forgiveness to give- wow! My anger diminished, my life got brighter and over time more and more time passes between bouts of hating myself or backsliding.
20 years in- life is genuinely good
I have found a way to live without the anger every minute - and I have never forgiven her.
Mostly, I just dont think of her.
It gets better. I swear.

author: whattfisthisshit
text: How do I guide myself to truly realize those things so I could also feel like life is brighter ?

author: rockyatcal
text:
Best advice I can give is also the most difficult: find support. People to lean on. People who believe you and believe IN you. Reach out. Find people -on here or at irl support groups.

Or a parent of a friend. If you feel like you can trust them, take a chance. Reach out to them and be honest.

It hurts to remember how little I believed in myself until I found my husband (now 32 yrs later still together).  The truth is love CAN eventually win out over all thier hate and hurt.

author: MrsWinchester2020
text: OMG...I'm so sorry you went through that! What a traumatic experience to go through, just to be told basically it's not that bad.

author: Ailithir
text:
As a cancer patient this makes me laugh so much (and cry a little bit): summer 2018 was spent in the ICU on breath support due to some complications and it was jarring how I could finally breath again (no pun intended) just because hospital rules limited the contact I had with my parents... nurses were amazed by how in high spirit I was for someone in my situation. And i mean: visit hours were the only thing I dreaded there :')

My beloved (s)mother still found ways to make it about herself cuz, I mean, I was such a terrible child for not wanting to chat with her and "forcing her to sit on an uncomfortable chair all day when she's so busy and came over just for my sake!", me and my failing lung... (and I was in such a good mood from the limited contact that I just told her "go home, then"... all hell cut loose, predictably, worth it tho üòÇ)

Also, ofc, talking from experience: if you have cancer they'll just tell you that *there's people with a worse cancer and you should feel lucky* instead

author: disbelief12
text: Can I just say -- that is a pretty jarring story about the effect Nparents can have on us? Not just that you were in the hospital and *improving* b/c it limited your exposure to her, but also that when she *did* get in, she was still way more concerned about herself (to the surprise of *no one*, I'm sure)? Jesus. I hope you are doing better, OP. No one deserves that. <3

author: Ailithir
text:
Yeah, I'm doing a lot better now, started attending school again and looking for a way to earn money she can't keep tabs on and that limited contact experience gave me the strength to at least stop listening to her all the time as I've had time to learn about myself, what I want and what I can do, which is more than what I ever thought~ (like telling her to go home if she was so bothered... would have never been able to do it before) I began to see a lot of things that now are painfully obvious but to which I was oblivious before

Right now I'm working on saving money and healing up. Remission can't come soon enough, I'll move out as soon as the doc tells me I'm good to go ( ÔΩ•`œâ¬¥ÔΩ•)Ÿà ÃëÃë

text:
We all started out oblivious -- don't be hard on yourself for that. But it's funny how getting distance can put their behavior in perspective. It's like suddenly being able to see The Matrix. ;-)

I wish you all the best finishing treatment (if it is still ongoing) and being able to get out of there as soon as possible! <3

author: Five_Decades
text:
Oh so you're unemployed, your kids just died, you have cancer, you have chronic pain and you suffer from depression?

Well someone on earth has all those conditions and a headache, so stop complaining.

Its an absurd argument. Its just designed to make people deny their own reality.

author: Goodgoditsgrowing
text:
Mine does this but with everything. I sprained my ankle ruining my only vacation the past two years, it was my fault because I was *walking* (never mind that someone turned off the light on the stairs I was descending) because I shouldn‚Äôt have been walking apparently, and I should be grateful it isn‚Äôt worse (despite the fact that I‚Äôm stuck sweating in an air-boot while it‚Äôs 100 degrees and everyone is at the beach). Also I should stop making her mad by doing things for myself, I should ask for help, and I‚Äôm asking for too much help and I need to do more for myself. But she 100% clear I‚Äôm ruining everyone‚Äôs vacation by not remaining chipper about not being able to so much as stand in the water. Never mind that I‚Äôm nothing makes me happier than being at the beach, in the waves, getting a serious pounding from the surf - I‚Äôm supposed to smile and tell everyone who keeps asking how I am that I‚Äôm just so happy to be here at all! I‚Äôm not. I know I‚Äôm a spoiled selfish brat, I understand, but goddamnit I deserve to be upset here!

I can‚Äôt even get down the stairs. I got yelled at for pissing in a bowl because I couldn‚Äôt walk to the bathroom the first night. I got yelled at for asking for the bag of chocolate from the fridge because at least I could still *eat*, but apparently I don‚Äôt need desert (fat) and other people would like to eat them.
